snippet.title: Mujhe Pota Chahye👹 #fyp #youtube #shorts #trending #fypシ #funnyvideo #shots #funny #views #desi #mom
snippet.description:
Mujhe Pota Chahye👹| Short 16| Iqra Aziz Talha Chahour #new #drama #fyp #youtube #shorts #trending #yt #meme #viral #punjabi #urdu #call

#iqraaziz 
#talhachahour 

Mannat is a beautiful young girl who hails from a progressive family that values love, care, and mutual respect. Raised in an environment where everyone's choices are respected, Mannat enjoys the freedom to make her own decisions. Following the untimely demise of her parents, she finds support from her elder brother, Nafees, who showers her with affection.

On the other hand, Murad belongs to a conservative family where his mother, the matriarch, wields significant influence over his life choices. As the only son, Murad is burdened with the responsibility of fulfilling his family's expectations. Soft-spoken and romantic by nature, Murad finds himself unable to defy his mother's authority, especially after the passing of his father.

Despite their starkly contrasting backgrounds, Mannat and Murad's hearts find solace in each other's presence, and they fall deeply in love. However, their families' interference creates misunderstandings between Mannat and Murad, testing the strength of their bond.

Will their families agree to their union? Will Mannat's family, with their open-mindedness, find common ground with Murad's conservative household? Can Mannat and Murad's love for each other withstand the motives of their families, who seek to create further misunderstandings between them?

Written by: Nadia Akhtar
Directed by: Syed Wajahat Hussain

snippet.title: Personal BEST 250 QSOs @ 1 Activation for Parks on the Air POTA US-1158 Hearst San Simeon State Park
snippet.description:
Hey, what's happening YouTube? 

I made 250 QSOs which is a record for me for one activation and one UTC day. I did have a day where I got 254 at one outing, but that was with UTC roll over so technically, it was 2 UTC days. Sorry, this is a long video but had a lot of great QSOs I wanted to share. See below if our QSO made the video. 73

snippet.title: 📡 What Is DMR Radio? Digital vs Analog Capabilities Explained
snippet.description:
In this video, we take a practical, real-world look at DMR (Digital Mobile Radio) and explain why preppers, radio enthusiasts, and preparedness-minded users may want to consider it over traditional analog FM radios.

We cover:
- What DMR actually is (and what it’s not)
- How DMR compares to analog FM
- Digital encryption vs analog voice scrambling
- Text messaging between radios
- Radio IDs, talk groups, zones, and real-world use
- Why DMR can be a powerful tool for secure, off-grid, tactical, and emergency communications

This is not a programming tutorial — that’s coming next — but a clear overview to help you decide if DMR is worth getting into for your preparedness setup.

⏱️ Video Chapters
00:00 – What is DMR? (Digital Mobile Radio explained)
00:52 – Analog FM vs DMR: live comparison demo
01:40 – Analog FM vs DMR: Live Demo
02:28 – Why Use DMR? Key Advantages
02:33 – Encryption Explained (DMR Demo)
04:37 – Radio IDs, Talk Groups & Seeing Who’s Talking
05:37 – Text Messaging with DMR Radios
07:11 – Do You Need a Ham License or DMR ID?
08:21 – Zones, GMRS, Repeaters & Analog Compatibility
12:02 – Final thoughts & wrap-up

🧭 Key Takeaways for Preppers & Emergency Communications
- DMR is a mode, not a band — many DMR radios still work on analog FM
- Encryption and texting are the biggest advantages over analog
- Private radio IDs can be used without public networks
- DMR radios can still operate on GMRS, ham, and analog repeaters
- Analog voice scrambling ≠ true encryption
- DMR offers far better privacy and capability, but requires more setup

snippet.title: Polar Modulation Explained: K1KP’s Radical Rethink of Amateur Radio
snippet.description:
For over 100 years, amateur radio transceivers have evolved through refinement rather than reinvention. Smarter DSP, better displays, more menus — but still fundamentally the same architecture.

Tony, K1KP, is changing that.

In this video, we explore Polar Modulation, a genuinely new RF technology developed by Tony that rethinks how amateur radio signals are generated, amplified and transmitted. This is not another incremental upgrade — it’s a fundamental shift in transceiver design.

Polar Modulation separates amplitude and phase, allowing dramatically improved efficiency, linearity and thermal performance compared with conventional radios. By moving away from legacy linear amplification techniques, this approach opens the door to simpler hardware, reduced losses and performance that simply wasn’t practical with traditional designs.

Full technical details, background and development notes are available on Tony’s QRZ page, where he documents the thinking and engineering behind Polar Modulation and the K1KP transceiver.

This could be amateur radio’s LED moment.

For a century, we perfected Edison’s light bulb. Then LEDs arrived — cooler, more efficient, longer-lasting and undeniably better. Once the transition happened, there was no going back.

Is Polar Modulation the same kind of leap for amateur radio?
Are we finally seeing a post-legacy transceiver architecture?
And what does this mean for the rigs we use today?

By the end of this video, you may find yourself asking a serious question:

Is it time to trade your rig?

#radio #hamradio #cb #communication #flexradio #aurora #polarmodulation #radiocommunication

snippet.title: The Top 3 POTA Myths of 2025 Debunked
snippet.description:
As the Parks on the Air (POTA) program continues to dominate the amateur radio landscape in 2025, its popularity has brought a wave of new operators into the fold. While the community is known for being helpful and welcoming, the "grapevine" occasionally produces misinformation.

Whether you are a seasoned activator or a hunter looking for your first contact, it is important to separate "ham radio lore" from the actual rules. Here are the top three POTA myths circulating in 2025 and the facts you need to know.

Myth 1: Activators Are Not Allowed in the US Extra Portion of the Band

One of the most persistent myths in 2025 is that POTA activations must take place within the "General" portions of the bands to ensure everyone can participate. Some operators believe that using the Extra Class sub-bands is "against the spirit" of the program or even against the rules.

The Reality:

You are permitted to activate from any frequency where you are legally licensed to operate. If you hold an Amateur Extra license in the US, you are perfectly entitled to find a clear spot in the lower portions of the 20m or 40m bands to start your pileup.

While many activators choose to stay in the General portion to maximize the number of hunters who can reach them, there is no rule forbidding the use of Extra segments. In fact, during high-activity weekends or major contests, moving into the Extra portion is often the only way to find a clear frequency.

Myth 2: Amplifiers Are Prohibited in POTA

Because POTA is often associated with "portable" operations, many people conflate it with QRP (Low Power) or "lightweight" programs, such as Summits on the Air (SOTA). This has led to the myth that using an amplifier or running high power is a violation of the POTA rules.

The Reality:

POTA is not a QRP-only program. You can activate a park using any power level you are legally allowed to run under your license class.

If you want to haul a generator and a 500-watt amplifier into a state park, you are more than welcome to do so. High power can be an excellent tool for overcoming poor band conditions or ensuring your signal reaches across the ocean for those coveted DX contacts. While "portable" usually implies battery power, the POTA rules are power-neutral; whether you’re running 5 watts or 1,500 watts, the activation is valid.

Myth 3: Park Numbers Must Be Exchanged to Count

Perhaps the most common source of stress for new activators is the belief that the park number must be exchanged over the air for the contact to be valid. This myth often leads to confusion during "Park-to-Park" (P2P) contacts, where operators scramble to write down four-digit designators amidst heavy QRM.

The Reality:

There is zero requirement to exchange park numbers for a contact to be valid.

The POTA system is "log-centric." When an activator uploads their log to the POTA website, they specify which park they were at. The system then automatically credits every hunter in that log with a contact from that specific park. Even in a Park-to-Park scenario, the "match" happens on the backend when both activators upload their logs.

While it is considered a courtesy and a fun part of the "exchange" to give your park number, your contact is not "invalid" if you miss it or if the other station doesn't provide theirs. As long as the callsigns are correct and the activator uploads their log, the credit will be issued.

Conclusion

Parks on the Air is designed to be a simple, inclusive, and fun way to get outside and use your radio. By dispelling these myths, we can lower the "barrier to entry" for new hams and make the bands a more productive environment for everyone.

The golden rule of POTA remains the same in 2025 as it was at the start: Follow your local licensing authority's regulations, be a good neighbour on the air, and have fun!

snippet.description:
Watch the playlist with all the videos mentioned in this video here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLR47RC3BimaqSavD8pWbjWVADAM2zzYXv

2025 was a standout year for amateur radio. Despite the usual claims that the hobby is 'slowing down', this year told a very different story. Real innovation, strong interest from new and returning operators, and manufacturers continuing to invest in exciting new products.

In this video, Tony and Dave sit down to reflect on the year and talk through ten of the most interesting and important products we covered on the channel in 2025. From flagship HF radios and modern SDR platforms to practical antennas, learning tools and clever operating aids, this is a relaxed look back at a year that showed just how healthy and active the hobby really is.

snippet.title: Why I Don’t Want an SDR Ham Radio
snippet.description:
Modern SDR radios are extraordinary pieces of engineering – and in the right environment, they absolutely shine.

But this video isn’t about specs, rankings, or what’s “best on paper”. It’s about how we listen.

After a recent video on upgrading "radio versus antenna", some fascinating comments prompted me to step back and reflect on something deeper: why, despite all the advances in SDR technology, I still prefer an older high-end analogue-based radio in a quiet location.

In this video I talk about:

- Quiet QTHs versus high-noise environments
- Why SDR radios can’t invent signal that didn’t arrive at the antenna
- Where DSP helps – and where it can get in the way
- Assembling callsigns from fragments in real pile-ups
- Stable noise, operator focus, and long-term listening fatigue
- Why trained ears sometimes outperform algorithms

This is not anti-SDR. It’s about understanding the trade-offs, the role of the operator, and why different radios suit different people and locations.

The best radio isn’t the one at the top of a list. It’s the one that lets you hear best.

Merry Christmas - and enjoy your radio.

snippet.title: That one teacher who *made* you get licensed! A hilarious trip back to 1992 Technician tests and ...
snippet.description:
The evolution of amateur radio licensing is truly fascinating. One operator recounts the strict mandate from an electronics teacher in the early nineties that led directly to passing the Technician exam in April 1992. Compare that requirement to the modern scenario where college students seek out their license purely for extra credit points! This segment offers a candid look at how personal commitment, educational requirements, and Volunteer Examiner teams shape the journey into the hobby. A unique perspective on the dedication required for a ham ticket.
#amateurradio #hamradio #hamtest #veprograms #ninetiestech #radiohistory #technicianlicense #electronicseducation #virtualexperience

snippet.title: Manuel WP4TZ: From Surf Breaks to Contest Pileups
snippet.description:
Manuel WP4TZ is a rising presence in Puerto Rican contesting. He came into ham radio through Summits on the Air, drawn by the mix of hiking and portable ops. That led to a deep run with Parks on the Air, using CW as his chosen mode. Now, he’s fully hooked on contesting. In just a few years, Manuel has gone from casual operator to committed contender—working pileups from both the wild terrain of Puerto Rico and the polished setups of WP3Z’s La Sierra Contest Group.

A recent 10-meter showdown in the ARRL contest brought him head-to-head with veteran ops WP3A and NP3A. They’ve got experience on their side, but Manuel held his own. With a quad at home, a hex beam waiting on a tower, and a strong crew of mentors, he’s climbing fast. He’s in it for the speed, the pressure, and the joy of riding a pileup all the way to the end.

But what stands out most is his humility. Whether it’s tweaking macros at WP3Z, surfing the northern coast, or hauling an Elecraft KX2 through the jungle, Manuel doesn’t pretend to know everything. He just keeps showing up, learning, and getting better. His advice to new contesters is simple: “Just go for it.”

Join the conversation and subscribe to Q5 Worldwide Ham Radio.

Thanks to DX Engineering for supporting operators at every level—from beachside POTA activators to full-throttle contesters chasing the top of the scoreboard. Their gear helps power the future of amateur radio.

localized.title: Manuel WP4TZ: From Surf Breaks to Contest Pileups
localized.description:
Manuel WP4TZ is a rising presence in Puerto Rican contesting. He came into ham radio through Summits on the Air, drawn by the mix of hiking and portable ops. That led to a deep run with Parks on the Air, using CW as his chosen mode. Now, he’s fully hooked on contesting. In just a few years, Manuel has gone from casual operator to committed contender—working pileups from both the wild terrain of Puerto Rico and the polished setups of WP3Z’s La Sierra Contest Group.

A recent 10-meter showdown in the ARRL contest brought him head-to-head with veteran ops WP3A and NP3A. They’ve got experience on their side, but Manuel held his own. With a quad at home, a hex beam waiting on a tower, and a strong crew of mentors, he’s climbing fast. He’s in it for the speed, the pressure, and the joy of riding a pileup all the way to the end.

But what stands out most is his humility. Whether it’s tweaking macros at WP3Z, surfing the northern coast, or hauling an Elecraft KX2 through the jungle, Manuel doesn’t pretend to know everything. He just keeps showing up, learning, and getting better. His advice to new contesters is simple: “Just go for it.”

snippet.title: Britt Gets Her Medical License Reinstated on General Hospital (Dec. 24, 2025)
snippet.description:
🧼 On Wednesday's episode of General Hospital, Britt and Lucas run into one another on the steps. Lucas suggests that they call a truce for Christmas. They chat, and Britt explained that Nina and her brother had invited her to a family gathering, but things are still icy with her mom, so it’s best that she was called into work. Later, Britt gets a photo from her mom of her and Nathan, and Lucas thinks it’s nice that her mom is thinking of her.

Later, Liz and Lucas chat about Portia and how they feel bad for her spending the holiday all alone. Britt returns, and Lucas says her phone got a notification. Britt reads an email and learns her medical license has been reinstated. She yells, “Merry Christmas to me!”

snippet.title: Floreciendo incluso en la adversidad|chicharrón de pota|arreglos en casa✨🍃
snippet.description:
Empezamos el día sacando a pasear a nuestros perritos dinosaurios por el campo 🐕🦖,
porque si no queman energía… ya saben cómo termina 😅
Al regresar les muestro como quedó mi yogurt natural casero 😂
Seguimos trabajando en contraplacar nuestra casita poco a poco.
Han sido días de trabajo arduo, de mover, clavar, limpiar y volver a empezar,
pero aunque el cuerpo se canse, la sonrisa se mantiene.
Porque cuando se construye con amor, todo pesa un poquito menos.
Y para cerrar el día, por fin les comparto la receta del famoso chicharrón de pota
que conquistó el corazón (y el estómago) de Hilario jajajaja 🍽️🦑
Dicen que el amor entra por el estómago… y confirmo 😌❤️
Gracias por acompañarnos una vez más en esta vida sencilla, real y llena de aprendizajes.
Si te gusta este tipo de videos, no olvides dejar tu like, comentar y suscribirte.
Eso nos ayuda muchísimo 🤍

snippet.title: QRP in the Wild: Two Colorado South Park Summits with one a Private-Land Activation #sota #hamradio
snippet.description:
Join me for a solo Summits on the Air adventure deep in South Park, Colorado! This trip includes two backcountry peaks—one on public land and one on privately owned mountain terrain. With permission secured, I strapped on the pack, hiked into the high country, and set up for some alpine HF fun.

Spinney MountainW0C/SP-118
Sulphur MountainW0C/SP-121

From crisp Colorado wind and quiet forest trails to the crackle of signals bouncing across the airwaves, this was the perfect mix of wilderness and ham radio. QRP, HF, SSB, and a dash of Morse code made for a memorable activation day.

If you’re into hiking, portable radio, SOTA, or just exploring the wide-open spaces of Colorado, you’ll enjoy this one.

73 and thanks for watching!

**Hashtags:**
#SOTA #SummitsOnTheAir #HamRadio #PortableRadio #QRP #ColoradoOutdoors #SouthParkColorado #HamRadioAdventure #MountainHiking #AmateurRadio #BackcountryRadio #HFPortable

snippet.title: Why This General Exam Question Confuses Hams (Speech Processors Explained)
snippet.description:
One General Class exam question trips up 4 out of 10 students — and it all comes down to understanding speech processors and average power.

In this Study Hall Session 2.0 clip, Professor Jim (N4BFR) breaks down:
 • How speech processors affect SSB signals
 • Why the answer is average power, not peak power
 • Common traps involving distortion, harmonics, and intermodulation
 • How to recognize this question instantly on the General exam

If you’re studying for your General license, this explanation will help the concept finally click.

👉 Start your General Class prep today:
https://hamradioprep.com

73 and good luck on your exam!

snippet.title: Collins AN/PRC-47 Military field radio from the Vietnam War.
snippet.description:
This video shows a AN/PRC-47 100 watt SSB transceiver that was designed for field and remote operation during the Vietnam war. Its semi portable and designed for use in harsh environments like South East Asia. I show a couple easy modifications that help make it a better radio to use today without taking too much away from the original experience of running one of them in the field.
All of thees old warhorses are fun to drag out, set up and operate.

snippet.title: Ham Radio Saves Santa, A New Amateur Radio Club, And Space-Based Ham-Radio TV Is Back Online!
snippet.description:
00:00 Ham Radio Saves Santa Clause
01:07 New Ham Radio Club
02:01 Space-Based Ham Radio TV Is Back Online
-- In this week's ham radio news, ham radio operators have finally made contact with.. The north pole, something never before achieved, since last christmas.
As reported by the Cynthiana Democrat News, ham radio operators in their never-ending quest to "make contacts" with anonymous men in exotic places around the world, have finally contacted the Big-Man himself at the north pole.  
And, as expected, one licensed Ham Radio operator was quick to warn anyone that would listen that "ham radio is serious business and All amateur radio operators MUST be licensed by the FCC and.. act professionally". In related serious and professional ham-radio news, the Santa Net on 3.916Mhz is back for its 20th consecutive year..
As one amateur radio operator was quoted as saying, he is "excited to be back on the air spreading holiday cheer on the ham bands"
Residents of the Bozeman Montana area are all bragging to their online friends because they now have a new amateur radio club.. This exciting and dynamic NEW amateur radio club will be different from the thousands of other amateur radio clubs because the new Headwaters Amateur Radio club offers Monthly meetings and workshops, license testing, community outreach and field days.. and contests. Anyone interested in joining this new and exciting Amateur Radio Club is invited to attend the club’s first meeting on January 19th .. 
Of course, as always in the ham-radio world, Newcomers are welcome to bring their questions, and seasoned ham-radio operators are encouraged to share their all of their very exciting ham-radio experiences.

In case you missed it, the HamTV setup on the International Space Station is now back online for the first time since 2018, and ham radio operators around the globe are completely giddy at the opportunity to be able to talk about the weather with someone that actually leaves their house.
For added fun and entertainment You can watch the historic first transmission in years in its entirety on the Amateur Radio on the ISS Youtube channel, here:  https://youtu.be/3QK4aT5qNSk?si=kNzPlMg1fFvLxJU4

In case you missed it, the HamTV setup on the International Space Station is now back online for the first time since 2018, and ham radio operators around the globe are completely giddy at the opportunity to be able to talk about the weather with someone that actually leaves their house.
For added fun and entertainment You can watch the historic first transmission in years in its entirety on the Amateur Radio on the ISS Youtube channel, here:  https://youtu.be/3QK4aT5qNSk?si=kNzPlMg1fFvLxJU4

snippet.title: The History Behind Radio Station Names
snippet.description:
Every time you turn on a radio, hear a broadcast, or listen to a ship at sea, there’s a hidden system quietly keeping everything in order. Those strange letters and numbers aren’t random. They exist for a reason.

In this video, we explore where call signs came from, why they look the way they do, and how a global framework keeps the airwaves from collapsing into chaos. From early wireless confusion to modern international coordination, this is the unseen structure behind everyday communication.

Once you notice it, you’ll hear it everywhere.

⏱️ Timestamps
0:03 – The Hidden Identity Behind Every Transmission
0:44 – Early Wireless Chaos
1:21 – What a Call Sign Actually Is
2:41 – How the World Standardized the Airwaves

4:17 – Maritime, Broadcast, and Amateur Radio
5:36 – Why Call Signs Still Matter

snippet.title: Several new Tennessee laws take effect on January 1, 2026. "Savanna's Law" creates a registry for re
snippet.description: Several new Tennessee laws take effect on January 1, 2026. "Savanna's Law" creates a registry for repeat domestic violence offenders, named after a slain sheriff's deputy. The "Ink of Hope Act" mandates human trafficking intervention training for tattoo artists to recognize and report potential victims. A new law permits licensed chiropractors to practice animal chiropractic with additional education and certification, despite veterinary association concerns. Finally, driver's license exams will now include questions about bicycle hand signals to improve road safety for cyclists. The Tennessee General Assembly will reconvene January 13, 2026.

snippet.title: How to Activate POTA Parks the RIGHT Way | Tips from a Park Manager
snippet.description:
What really counts as a valid Parks on the Air (POTA) activation? 🌲📡

In this conversation, Jim (N4BFR) sits down with Claude (AC4SH) — the POTA park manager for Georgia — to break down how parks are selected, managed, and activated, and how operators can avoid common mistakes while maximizing contacts.

Claude shares insider knowledge on park boundaries, trail activations, and how to legally and correctly log two-fers and three-fers when parks overlap.

You’ll learn:
🗺️ How POTA park boundaries actually work (especially trails like the Appalachian Trail)
🚫 Why city & county parks do NOT qualify for POTA
📏 What “within 100 feet” really means for valid activations
🔄 How overlapping parks create two-fers and three-fers
📚 How to research parks using the POTA website and photo wiki
🤝 Why reaching out to recent activators can dramatically improve your activation
🌄 Which parks offer the best opportunities for multi-park activations

Whether you’re brand new to POTA or looking to activate more efficiently, this video will help you operate with confidence and accuracy.

📢 Get Started & Log Smarter

🌲 Find parks, plan activations, and hunt contacts:
👉 https://pota.app/

📊 Log your POTA activations, track stats, and compete live:
👉 https://worldradioleague.com/

World Radio League makes it easy to log contacts, visualize your activations, and see real-time POTA activity around the world.

snippet.title: HOA Karen Cut My Ham Radio Cables - FBI Showed Up in Black SUVs 😱 #shorts
snippet.description:
An HOA Karen cut my ham radio cables while I was providing emergency weather communications. She had no idea she'd just committed a FEDERAL CRIME.
What started as HOA harassment turned into an FBI investigation when she interfered with licensed emergency radio operations. The consequences? Federal charges, up to $250,000 in fines, and possible prison time.
This is what happens when entitled people think they're above the law. Justice was served.
🎯 Story Highlights:
• Licensed ham radio operator for 15 years
• HOA president deliberately cut cables during emergency weather net
• FBI investigated under 18 U.S.C. § 1362
• Federal charges filed against HOA Karen
• She resigned and faced serious legal consequences
⚠️ Moral of the story: Don't mess with federally protected communications systems!
💬 Have you dealt with HOA nightmares? Share your story in the comments!
👍 Like if you believe in justice

snippet.title: Я строю КВ радиостанцию - 2. Я. С. Лаповок, UA1FA. Сборка и настройка трансивера TRX.
snippet.description:
В этом видео, я расскажу как приемник Я.С. Лаповка (UA1FA), из знаменитой, черной брошюры «Я строю КВ радиостанцию - 2», второй вариант.., превратить в полноценный трансивер.📖

Этот и другие трансиверы автора открыли мир самостоятельной сборки и творчества, подарив многим мечту о собственном КВ-трансивере. 🚀

В этом выпуске я поделюсь своим опытом сборки, настройки и расскажу о своих ошибках и их решениях. Я дам несколько ценных советов для новичков, покажу, как избежать типовых проблем.
Это видео — не просто сборка, это дань уважения истории и отличный повод вдохновиться на новый проект! 💡

Что вас ждёт в этом ролике?

Мой личный опыт сборки и работы над ошибками.
Ценные советы для начинающих конструкторов.
Практические решения проблем.
👍 Если вам понравилось видео, ставьте лайк, подписывайтесь на канал и делитесь с друзьями!
📝 Делитесь своей историей! Расскажите в комментариях, с какими трудностями вы сталкивались при сборке этого трансивера, и что вас вдохновило на этот проект.

#трансиверлаповка #ua1fa #ястроюкврадиостанцию #самодельныйтрансивер #кврадиостанция #сборкатрансивера #схематрансивера #умножительчастоты #конструкциидлярадиолюбителей #электроникадляначинающих

localized.title: Я строю КВ радиостанцию - 2. Я. С. Лаповок, UA1FA. Сборка и настройка трансивера TRX.
localized.description:
В этом видео, я расскажу как приемник Я.С. Лаповка (UA1FA), из знаменитой, черной брошюры «Я строю КВ радиостанцию - 2», второй вариант.., превратить в полноценный трансивер.📖

Этот и другие трансиверы автора открыли мир самостоятельной сборки и творчества, подарив многим мечту о собственном КВ-трансивере. 🚀

В этом выпуске я поделюсь своим опытом сборки, настройки и расскажу о своих ошибках и их решениях. Я дам несколько ценных советов для новичков, покажу, как избежать типовых проблем.
Это видео — не просто сборка, это дань уважения истории и отличный повод вдохновиться на новый проект! 💡

Что вас ждёт в этом ролике?

Мой личный опыт сборки и работы над ошибками.
Ценные советы для начинающих конструкторов.
Практические решения проблем.
👍 Если вам понравилось видео, ставьте лайк, подписывайтесь на канал и делитесь с друзьями!
📝 Делитесь своей историей! Расскажите в комментариях, с какими трудностями вы сталкивались при сборке этого трансивера, и что вас вдохновило на этот проект.

#трансиверлаповка #ua1fa #ястроюкврадиостанцию #самодельныйтрансивер #кврадиостанция #сборкатрансивера #схематрансивера #умножительчастоты #конструкциидлярадиолюбителей #электроникадляначинающих

snippet.title: Ham Radio General Class: Frequencies, Modes, and FCC Rules
snippet.description:
Ready to upgrade from Technician to General Class and unlock HF privileges? Join our FREE YouTube video series: "Ham Radio General License Mastery" – the ultimate prep course for the FCC Amateur Radio General Exam!
Based on the official 2023-2027 General Class Element 3 question pool (valid through June 30, 2027), we break down every subelement with crystal-clear explanations, real-world examples, and bite-sized lessons on key topics like antenna systems, propagation, electrical principles, safety, and operating procedures. No fluff – just what you need to ace the 35-question exam with confidence.

Get Your License Manual Here - https://geni.us/7vLlwsK

snippet.title: 🛫 B737-800NG Oceanic Flight | HF Radio Ops Over Atlantic | YYZ to Barbados Landing.
snippet.description:
Experience the full journey from Toronto (YYZ) to Barbados (BGI) in the Boeing 737‑800NG, flying deep into the WATRS oceanic region with HF radio in action. This flight showcases real‑world long‑range procedures, oceanic communication, and a stunning approach into the Caribbean.

In this video, you’ll see:

•  ✅ Oceanic entry procedures on the WATRS route
•  ✅ HF radio calls and long‑range communication
•  ✅ B737‑800NG cockpit workflow during cruise and descent
•  ✅ Scenic arrival and landing in Barbados
•  ✅ A pilot’s perspective on managing oceanic ops in a narrow‑body jet

Whether you're a pilot, aviation enthusiast, or someone who loves cockpit POVs, this flight delivers a rare look at Atlantic operations, HF comms, and Caribbean flying.

🔥 If you enjoy cockpit videos, oceanic ops, or aviation storytelling, hit LIKE and SUBSCRIBE for more flights.
